stories.text:
People usually view documents on a computer now, which means that page margins and page breaks don’t matter.

So maybe WYSIWYG is not the best term to use since what you see on the screen doesn't necessarily match what you see in the output.

Another point: I use Fira Code for programming because I like the ligatures. Moreover, I use TeXmacs to write notes because I like the way the text is typeset with high quality while I edit my notes. In both cases, the editing experience is made more pleasant but other people don't see the nice visuals. In other words, WYSIWYG is problematic because there is no output that matches the editing experience.

So maybe meta-WYSIWYG would be a better term to use nowadays to take into account these considerations?
stories.title: Ask HN: Change WYSIWYG to meta-WYSIWYG to better reflect the reality of 2022?
One of the World’s Wealthiest Oil Exporters Is Becoming Unlivable
Apple will now require employees to submit proof of Covid-19 booster shot

stories.text:
As of 2022, are there any de-facto standards of data delivery methods (services, protocols, providers) between different companies? Think, Kafka but between different orgs.

Let's assume that the question is about general-case transactional data delivery, so it can't be satisfied by S3 or leading warehouse SaaS (say the receiving side doesn't use those).
stories.title: Ask HN: Intercompany Data Delivery. How?
China builds artificial moon to simulate low gravity
You can't move tabs in Linux Chrome
